Api Views¶

apps.api.views.add_link(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Create a new link in a given section of a documentation page. If the section and page don’t exist create them as well.

POST type request.

Parameters:
  • page_title (str) – Title of documentation’s page
  • url (str) – URL of documentation’s page
  • section_id (str) – HTML ID of section
  • section_title (str) – Title of section
  • link_url (str) – URL of new link
Returns:

dict
Example :

{‘id’: 7, ‘url’: ‘http://one.to.rule_them.al/l, ‘title’: ‘Knights of Foo Bar, ‘is_relevant’: True,}
apps.api.views.init(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return number of user links for known sections of a documentation page.

GET type request.

Parameters:url (str) – url of the documentation page
Returns:dict
Example :{ ‘sections’: { ‘s-queryset-api-reference’: 3, ‘s-when-querysets-are-evaluated’: 5, ‘s-pickling-querysets’: 2 } }

Note

xss_json_response decorator dumps the response into a json, wraps with a HttpResponse and makes it xss friendly

apps.api.views.qa_links(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Return a set of QA links for a given section.

GET type request.

Parameters:
  • url (str) – url of the documentation page containing the section
  • page_title (str) – meta title of the documentation page containing the section
  • section_id (str) – id of the html tag containing the section
  • section_title (str) – title of section
Returns:

dict
Example :

{‘links’: [{ ‘url’: ‘http://test.com‘, ‘title’: ‘Title’,}, { ‘url’: ‘http://example.com‘, ‘title’: ‘Example’,}, { ‘url’: ‘http://super.com‘, ‘title’: ‘Super’,},]}

Note

xss_json_response decorator dumps the response into a json, wraps with a HttpResponse and makes it xss friendly

apps.api.views.set_relevant(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Set the ‘is_relevant’ flag of a link.

POST type request.

:param : id of a link :type : int

:param : is_relevant :values : 0 or 1 :type : int

Returns:dict
Example :{}
apps.api.views.users_links(*args, **kwargs)¶

Return all links added by users for a given section.

GET type request.

Parameters:
  • url (str) – url of the documentation page containing the section
  • section_id (str) – id of the html tag containing the section
Returns:

dict
Example :

{‘links’: [{ ‘id’: 12, ‘url’: ‘http://test.com‘, ‘title’: ‘Title’, ‘is_relevant’: True, ‘up_votes’: 5,}, { ‘id’: 17, ‘url’: ‘http://example.com‘, ‘title’: ‘Example’, ‘is_relevant’: True, ‘up_votes’: 3,}, { ‘id’: 14, ‘url’: ‘http://super.com‘, ‘title’: ‘Super’, ‘is_relevant’: False, ‘up_votes’: 2,},]}

Note

xss_json_response decorator dumps the response into a json, wraps with a HttpResponse and makes it xss friendly

apps.api.views.vote_up(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

Increment the ‘up_votes’ count for a link.

POST type request.

:param : id of a link :type : int

Returns:dict
Example :{}
